meanings.definition: To accumulate a large supply of something for future use.
meanings.sent1: She stockpiled canned food in case of an emergency.
meanings.sent2: The company stockpiled resources to prepare for the busy season.
meanings.sent3: He stockpiled so many snacks that his friends joked he was preparing for a snack apocalypse.
meanings.sent4: The student stockpiled knowledge like a squirrel gathering nuts for winter.
meanings.sent5: The farmer stockpiled hay in the barn, ready for the long winter ahead.

meanings.definition: A supply of goods or materials stored for future use.
meanings.sent1: The stockpile of blankets kept the refugees warm during the cold nights.
meanings.sent2: The army had a stockpile of weapons hidden in the underground bunker.
meanings.sent3: The stockpile of candy in the cupboard tempted the children every time they passed by.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a stockpile of joy that brightened up the room.
meanings.sent5: The treasure chest was a stockpile of riches beyond imagination.
